name: Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
description:
Smash Up is back with even more wild factions in the mix! Science Fiction Double Feature brings four new decks to the base-smashing business with abilities unlike those seen before!


     Time Travelers allow you to reuse your cards time and time again
     Cyborg Apes take actions that attach to your minions and take them to a whole new level
     Super Spies use their mojo in espionage to plot out the future of you and your opponents
     Shapeshifters could be anyone!


Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature can be played on its own as a two-player game or combined with other Smash Up titles to allow for up to four players to compete at the same time.

Integrates with:

    Smash Up

name: Wands
description:
Wands is a fast-paced fantasy card battle for two to five players, combining elements of Uno and Magic: The Gathering.

You play the role of a witch or wizard, engaged in a magical battle with your opponents.  You and your rivals start with 10 life points each.  Using a combination of Blasts (unblockable magicks), Spells, and Counter-Spells, you try to reduce your opponents to zero life points and be the last spellcaster standing.

If you cast a Spell, opponents have a chance to cast their Counter-Spells.  Multiple Counter-Spells can be cast on each other, adding more damage and greater effects, shifting effects, or canceling them altogether.  Imagine one of the wand battles from the Harry Potter movies and you get the idea.  It's quite fun to cast a spell on your buddy, watch someone shift the effects to someone else and add to it, watch someone else shift the effects to yet another player, watch someone dispel that shift, watch the next person dispel that shift, and finally, you shift it back to the original target.

Wands is best with two to five players.  Games can be as short as a couple of minutes, and it shouldn't take more than ten minutes for anyone to learn the rules.

Wands is not a collectible card game.  You only need one set of cards; there's nothing to collect; no booster packs; no rarity; no drafts.  This is the full game.

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
description:
All Hands on Deck!

There's adventure to be had on the high seas when a group of press-ganged pirates becomes embroiled in the plots and plunder of the Shackles—an infamous island chain dominated by pirate warlords. But as these new swashbucklers make names for themselves, rival scalawags, enemy navies, legendary sea monsters, and the infamous Hurricane King himself seek to see them walk the plank. Who will survive when there's loot on the line?

Launch a campaign to control the Shackles with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles Base Set. This complete cooperative strategy card game pits 1 to 4 heroes against the traps, monsters, deadly magic, and despicable foes of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game’s award-winning Skull & Shackles Adventure Path. Choose your character’s class; build a deck of allies, equipment, and magic; and explore lethal locations as you journey through multiple scenarios in an exciting fantasy adventure. Characters grow stronger after each game, adding unique gear and awesome magic to their decks, and gaining incredible powers, all of which they’ll need to challenge greater threats in a complete Pathfinder Adventure Card Game Adventure Path.

The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles Base Set includes:


     Nearly 500 cards, featuring a richly customizable assortment of equipment and magic, and dozens of allies, monsters, and villains from the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path.
     7 character classes to choose from, including 4 brand-new ones: Gunslinger, Magus, Oracle, and Swashbuckler; 3 returning characters: Bard, Fighter, and Rogue. Returning characters from Rise of the Runelords are new versions for this game.
     The Wormwood Mutiny Adventure Deck, the beginning of the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path.
     A complete set of 5 polyhedral dice.

name: Speelgoedkist
description:
Card game from the Dubbel en dwars series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides.

There are a number of cards with toys on the table. The top card of the discard pile is turned over. Everyone grabs now ASAP cards which comply with the requirements on the card on the discard pile. This Continues till the deck runs out.

The player with the most cards at the end wins the game.

name: Lettermix
description:
Card game from the Dubbel en dwars series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides.

In Lettermix everyone plays simultaneously. You try to play a card with a letter which matches (also in color) a letter of the top card of the discard pile. When you play a card with more equal letters, you may give a card to each other player. The first player that has played all his cards wins the game immediately.

name: Shape Up
description:
Card game from the Dubbel en dwars series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides.

In Shape Up everyone plays simultaneously. You try to play a card with an angle that corresponds (also in color) with a symbol at the top card of the discard pile. When you play a card with more equal angles, you may give a card to each other player. The first player that has played all his cards wins the game immediately.

name: Provincia Romana
description:
Provincia Romana is a game of strategy and urban development for 2-6 players.

As the leader of a Roman city in Gaul, you are responsible for its growth. You must manage your city's economy and resources, starting from its very first building. You must also see to your city's defenses, preparing for Gallic raids and forging dubious agreements with the powerful Roman Senate. You must always keep in mind the morale of your people and the wear and tear on your military defenses. If you do not want to face destruction, you must maintain everything to the high standards of Roman greatness.

Success will reward you with prestige and glory. Become the most prestigious governor and you will be chosen as the new Proconsul of a mighty Provincia Romana!

name: Starship Battles
description:
In Starship Battles, each player commands a starship and seeks to destroy his opponents. The game ends after one player has completely destroyed all of his opponents’ ship compartments.

Ships are customized at the start of the game, then face off against each other. The compartments each ship has are up to the players, who must strike a balance between offense, defense, repairability, and command.

Players start the game by drawing ship compartment cards from the deck. Each ship compartment can take a certain amount of damage before it is destroyed. When a ship compartment is destroyed, it is discarded. Part of the strategy of Starship Battles lies in how one chooses to manage battle damage.

As the turns progress, players attack one another using their weapons, defend themselves using their shields, change their attacks or defends using command points, and repair damage using engineering capability.

name: Nine Lives Card Game
description:
Cats are running loose through the city! There are nine different breeds, five cats each, each with their own personalities. Rescue as many cats as you can, but try not to get scratched!

NINE LIVES is a fast game of trading, bidding, and clever tactics. Each round, all players bid a numbered card from their hand. High bids use special powers first, which can force trades between players. Then, low bids get first choice of cats to rescue, which is key scoring victory points and winning the game. Score points by rescuing the majority of a breed, rescuing any cats of a rare breed, and finally one point per scratch... but only if you have the *fewest* scratches!

name: Baseball Highlights: 2045
description:
American baseball was on its last legs as a spectator sport. Football had become the predominant national pastime — that is until the year 2032, the year baseball decided to revolutionize the game and regain the throne!

Starting in 2032, baseball games were shortened to six innings. Pitchers were encouraged to have bionic arm implants to improve their pitching. These cyborgs, or 'Borgs as they're affectionately known, were immediately popular and soon ruled the league. In 2041, robotic players were introduced to get more offense back into the game. These robots were similar to designated hitters in that they were used only to bat and did not field. However, recent reports indicate fielding 'Bots are on the way.

Now in 2045, human players are still in the game and known as Naturals. They are the best fielders by far but are sorely challenged when it comes to hitting and pitching. Some Naturals have learned to hit by swinging before the pitcher starts his windup, which gives them a chance to hit the ball. Although it's hard for a Natural to get into the league, those who do are popular. Many Naturals have named themselves after the great players of pre-2032 baseball by taking a first and last name borrowed from different star players of the past. The fans love them, and their presence on the team ensures good revenue!

The stage is now set! The fans are energized and root fanatically for their new favorites, be they 'Bots, 'Borgs or Naturals!

Baseball Highlights: 2045 is like watching TV highlights of early 21st-century baseball games, with the gameplay being full of theme with no outs or innings and without bogging down in a play-by-play baseball simulation. In this quick and interactive game, two players build their teams as they play, combining both strategy (building your team) and tactics (playing the game) without any of the downtime. During each "mini-game", each player alternates playing six cards to simulate a full game's highlights. The mini-game includes defensive and offensive actions, and your single card play may include elements of defensive and/or offensive plays. Do you try to thwart your opponent's pending hits, put up strong offensive action of your own, or use your better players to do both? Players buy new free agents after each mini-game to improve their roster, and the team who wins the most mini-games in the series is the champ!

The contents of Baseball Highlights: 2045 box is:

1 rulebook

4 stadium mats
4 reference sheets

120 cards:

     60 starter cards
     60 free agent cards




60 wooden pawns:

     20 red
     20 white
     20 blue




12 cardboard markers:

     4 triangular markers (visitor/home)
     8 circular markers

name: Slimes: The Battle for the Boss Medallion
description:
The Boss Medallion is a relic awarded to various dungeon trash mobs and underlings that grants them the title of "Boss Monster". and Once there was a cave in which dwelled a dragon whelp who possessed such a Medallion. One day, the whelp came to this realization: if he is destined to grow up to become a mighty Dragon, a force powerful enough to threaten possibly even the world's existence, what use does he have for such trinkets?

And so begins the Battle for the Boss Medallion: a contest/game in which the dragon whelp has granted the opportunity to earn a Boss Title to one of the dungeon world's lowest inhabitants, the Slime!

(The competing Slime lieutenants (the players) each have 10 health and take turns playing their Slime minions (cards) onto the Play Pile following rules similar to the card game B.S. Whenever a lieutenant's Bluff is called, a duel follows, with the loser taking damage from the recently played Slime Minions. These tactics and blows are exchanged until only one lieutenant is left standing to claim the whelp's Medallion!)

Summary and Additional Notes:


    Bluffing card game with Slime Combat!



    Each deck features a different color mix of slimes.



    Jokers and Slime abilities add even more strategy to the game.

name: Pile o' Bones
description:
You and your associates have been given the task of moving the remains of four families from the local cemetery to a new one, but due to laziness, incompetence, and a general lack of morals, the contents have “shifted” during shipping and you’re left with a big pile o’ bones.

The families’ living relatives have agreed not to press charges against the first person to sort and put to rest the bones of one entire family. Of course, being an unscrupulous lot, you’ve agreed that “mostly right” is good enough…

Pile o' Bones is a simple yet deep family card game where each player is trying to put their family of four to rest.

A player only needs to own a majority of the bones in a completed skeleton to claim it. Players may draw new bones randomly from the bone pile hoping to get what they need or they may strategically break apart and move a partially constructed skeleton.

Once a skeleton is completed, whoever owns the majority of the bones claims it as one of their family's members and puts them to rest.

name: Renaissance Investments Monopoly
description:
Renaissance Investments Monopoly is a marketing/promotional board game created and distributed by USAopoly for Renaissance Investments (which is owned by CIBC Asset Management). It is a derivative of Monopoly and its game play is identical to Monopoly in most respects.

The primary difference is that the properties, utilities, cards, etc. are oriented to the Renaissance Investments corporation. Aside from this, using the roll-and-move mechanic, players buy properties, build houses and hotels, and collect rent from fellow players. The player who doesn't go bankrupt is the winner.

name: Windscorers
description:
Windscorers is a boardgame tribute of the Neo Geo's videogame called "Windjammers".

Windscorers is an sports boardgame in which two players face off in a court separated by a net and surrounded by walls. Your aim is throw the frisbee and make point in your rival’s goal.

Mechanics summary:
There are 6 characters with different technical characteristics: movement, shot power, shot technique, defence, energy shots, and a special skill.

Each player has standard deck to do the different shots.
There is also a event deck that provides extra benefits to the player.
Each turn the forward player prepares his shot. To prepare it, you play a direcction card to move the frisbee with a fixed pattern of movement. You can vary the frisbee pattern using 1 or 2 style cards. 
When shot is made, the defender will try to catch the frisbee. The defender can try catch it if the frisbee pass by his defence zone. How much far the frisbee pass, will be more difficult to catch it.

Each match is played to 3 sets.

name: Ucrónika
description:
Ucrónika is a card game which helps to develop imagination, creativity and improvisation.

The players turn into narrators of histories who take as a starting point a historical event from which they must create an alternative reality, besides the historical fact they will have to include in their history a series of narrative elements that will depend on the cabin in which they are in the gameboard, the other players may add new elements to the narration.

The object of the game is to earn more points than the others players. Each player can earn points as the narrator telling the story and as a player adding elements and asking the narrator.

name: Die Ketchup Vampire Card Game
description:
A cardgame based on an animated TV-series called "Die Ketchup-Vampire". Game includes 56 playing Cards and is similiar to an old german traditional cardgame called Mau-Mau that is close to the wellknown UNO.
 Players will start with 6 cards each and play one card each turn following suit or color. About half of the cards have wellknown rules like "draw 1 or 2 cards", "lose turn", "choose color", but also special rules like "guess card under the magic book card played", or "stop play and play card no matter whose turn it is".

Game ends when one player has played all his cards. Cards still in hand will score negative points.

name: Reverse Charades: Canadian Edition, Eh!
description:
From the back of the box:
Hysterical fun from "a" to "zed"

O Canada! Get ready to show your Great White North pride as you face-off against your fellow Canucks for some big-time laughter. Reverse Charades is a hilarious twist on the normal charades game you know-where one person acts out the words for the team to guess (boring)! With Reverse Charades, your entire team has 60 seconds to act out as many classic Canadian-themed words as one guesser can guess.

It's fast-paced, fiercely-fun team competition-a strange brew of action-packed hilarity sure to have Canadians from sea to sea raising their hockey sticks and jumping on their chesterfields to celebrate! You'll have such a blast that no party, game night, family gathering or team-building event will ever be complete without Reverse Charades (ok, and Nanaimo bars, too)!

name: Championship Speedway Racing StockCar Game
description:
A roll and move StockCar Racing game.

Roll 2 d6, move the number of spaces on higher of the d6. If doubles are rolled, you check the chart for lane changes and spaces moved.

Various spaces on the board may cause you to lose turn(s), drop back spaces, move forward spaces, go to Pit Row (causes you to restart lap) or lose the race.

First player to complete 5 laps wins.

Components: board, 6 pawns, 2d6, 2 1/64 scale die cast cars, instructions.

name: Robots vs. Dinosaurs
description:
Robots vs. Dinosaurs is the third game in the Army vs. Aliens series, with each game being playable on its own while also allowing for any faction in one game to be played against any faction in another or for multiple sets to be combined for team games or "last man standing" challenge matches.

In Robots vs. Dinosaurs, each player takes one of the factions and rolls all nine dice. Taking turns, players then either attack the opponent or use a special power. Dice that are used are placed into the dice cup. If a player cannot attack or use a power, he instead "rallies", rolling the dice cup and simultaneously rerolling all of his dice still in play.

The two forces have different special powers, and players want to move dice into their scoring zone to win. If five rounds pass without either player scoring, then the game ends and the player who has the most dice in his scoring zone wins.

name: Hauler
description:
America has been fascinated by the big rig truck for decades.  Kids make signals out the back window, just hoping to hear that horn blast away as the trucker goes by and we benefit everyday from these massive machines moving goods and materials from coast to coast over the maze of our highways.  Hauler is a game dedicated to the Big Rig Trucker in all of us!

Hauler is a game for 2-5 players where the goal is to build a deck of resources that will give you the most victory points.  VPs are earned on cards or by running routes off of route cards purchased with Green Stamps (Money in Trucker Lingo).  Green Stamps are earned playing cards out of your hand each turn.  Green stamps can be used on your turn to purchase route cards, truck cards, fuel cards or action cards.

The rules of the game are complex.  Think of Hauler as part deck builder and part strategy board game.  Each turn a player can drive up to 12 hours each turn per truck or you draw 5 cards from their deck and purchase additional cards based on the green stamp value of the cards in play. Of course, there are complications and strategy to be had, as other players may be eyeing the same route you just passed on picking up, or may get to a hitchhiker before you if you take an extra deckbuilding turn. The decision is yours, and makes for great strategic conundrums in this 90-120 minute game.

name: Gladiatoris
description:
GLADIATORIS is a board game from 1 to 4 players (up to 6 with any of our future expansions sets), that recreates Roman amphitheatre’s combats. Each player takes the role of a lanista -gladiator trainer-, and must send their Beasts, Slaves and Gladiators to face their rivals'. The winner will be the player with more Sestertii after all the combats, no matter if their combatants outlived them or not.

In GLADIATORIS, each player chooses a gladiator school, a team of fighters specialized in a particular combat technique. To achieve victory, they will need good judgement investing their money, as well as combat expertise, luck and the favor of the gods.

Basic Game teams:  SCUTARII (Great Shields, reds), PARMULARII (Small Shields, greens), SINE SCUTO (No Shield, blues), PETAURISTAE (Acrobats, orange).

name: Mikawa Monogatari
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #17.

Campaign level wargame for the Ikko-shu uprising of the Mikawa province in the Japanese Sengoku Period. Mikawa is the home province for Tokugawa Ieyasu, the first shogun of the Tokugawa Shogunate.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Azukizaka_(1564)

This game was issued in Wargame Japanese History #17. The game name means the Story of the Mikawa Province, the Rioting record of Mikawa Province.

This game using basic engine of Taiheiki. Players control either the Tokugawa clan or the Uprising force of Ikko-shu. In each turn, players determine initiative, and then players move their own force alternately. Finally, after all movement is done, they resolve combat.

Winner determined by victory points, mostly earned from control of areas.

name: Genki Soran: Solitaire of Nobunaga Houi-mou
description:
Solitaire wargame of Oda Nobunaga 1570-1582 campaign.

The name means Battles in Genki: solitaire of Surrounded Nobunaga. Genki was one of the Japanese era names in part of the Sengoku period.

The player manages resources and vassals of the Oda clan, and allocates them to various hostile clans. Hostile clans are driven by the event cards.
The player wins when he defeats all hostile clans.


1st edition: issue game of Wargame Japanese History #18.
2nd edition: Command Japan "The Best" 17.

name: Swintus 3D

From publisher:

A genuine Swintus always thinks about food and would never give up a chance to store some! Prove that you are the best at hoarding food. Start chasing those calories now!

Each player has 7 dice of his or her own color. The players roll their dice and use the results to obtain food cards right before their opponents can do the same. The first player to collect 7 pieces of the same food wins the game.

name: End of the World Card Game
description:
A zombie themed Cards Against Humanity. Each round, a player reads a survival scenario from a red "Survival" card, and all the other players answer with their best white "Provision" card(s).

The leader for each round then re-reads the red survival card and each of the provision cards, and selects their favorite to keep the group moving forward through the apocalypse. The winning survivor holds onto the red apocalyptic scenario card which equals one point.
 Continue in clockwise fashion with a new leader reading in each round. Be sure to have 10 provision cards in your hand each round (unless increased or decreased by trump cards).

The provision deck includes 8 reanimation cards that players can keep and use to get a new hand, and 2 CDC cards that forces everyone to get new hands. The scenario deck includes 5 double tap cards where two 1-fer scenario cards are drawn and the played provision cards must apply to both.

name: The King's Hunters
description:
The King's Hunter is a fast game for 2-11 players, based on games of Family Werewolf, One Night Werewolf and One Night Ultimate Werewolf, and the basic system is based on the game Win, Lose, or Banana.

It's a micro-game of 16 cards.

This game is played in several rounds, determined at the beginning of the game.

The winner will be the player with the most points, or most money with the betting game.

A role card is dealt to each player. King, Queen, and Hunters show their role card, Werewolves and Vampires don´t show it. First the King will draw one of the two cards of Gods (Favour of the gods or No Favour of the gods). Afterwards the King will order hunt Werewolves or Vampires. Hunters will think first to retire or not to retire. If they decide to hunt, they must fight with the beast orders by the King. Queen will be a partnership of the King.

name: Moscow vs. Barbarossa, 1941
description:
A small-scale (9 hexes from Smolensk to Moscow, 27mis/43kms per hex) Battle of Moscow game, MvB41 has 32 Russian and 22 German corps-to-army-level units, and takes 2-3 hours to play 8 half-month turns (or less, if Moscow is taken).

MvB41 draws on many design concepts and much research from my other games, including and especially from my new division level Battle of Moscow game, Barbarossa's Climax: Moscow 1941

As for most of my other games, the game's system uses Disruption to simulate momentum of advance/retreat and inertia.  A powerful German panzerkorps has a combat power of 4, and German units have step reduction.  The airwar is abstracted as in BC, and there is a Katyushas (rocket) unit.

The combat odds round-off (including UP) and expansion rule is retained from Barbarossa's Climax, as are other rules, but much more playably in the smaller - more introductory level - format.

The game is free to print off, assemble, and play.

name: Black Friday: The Card Game
description:
"All the fun of beating up your fellow holiday shoppers and stealing stuff from their cart on Black Friday - without the risk of facing criminal charges for your bad behavior."

It's Black Friday, the first "official" shopping day for Christmas, all the sales, all the hype, all the bad behavior of fellow shoppers as 25 people vie for the 10 items available.

There's a limited number of Christmas Gifts available to the "shoppers", and some are more valuable (victory points) than others.  There are opportunities to get a couple low value toys which compliment each other and give a score boost!

Then there are the Dirty Tactics that shoppers use to try to snatch Items from other shoppers' carts, and the Defensive Maneuvers that will keep your stuff safe!

As the shopping day progresses, Events will happen, where some circumstances may change, or they may only affect one shopper.

The shopping event ends when the "Check Out" card is drawn, which is randomly shuffled into the bottom of the draw deck.  So get all your Items, try to snatch other shoppers' Items, and attempt to keep your Items safe until the sale is over!

name: F5
description:
"It's Construction vs. Destruction."  "The game that throws strategy to the wind"

You all work for a construction company that builds trailer parks -sorry, "Luxury Manufactured Housing Gated Communities" in Tornado Alley.  Construction picks up as the wind dies down.  It's a race to cooperatively, yet strategically, build trailer parks to a minimum required size, get the gates installed and get the Construction Invoice in-hand, before a surprise tornado rips thru and erases all your hard work.

Tornado's range from F1 to F5, with appropriate varied damage.  Tornadoes not only affect the trailer parks, but they can also force players to move positions at the table, make them trade hands, or even Invoices, with other players!

You'll never know what's coming down the line regarding tornadoes.  During Set-up, you randomly and secretly select tornadoes to remove, and as you cycle thru the draw deck, you randomly and secretly remove additional tornadoes, so the tempo builds, the tension grows, and the game comes to a quick victory.

name: Talvisota
description:
Talvisota (Winter War) is a cooperative game for 2-4 players.

The players are finnish commanders in one of the four frontlines, and they have to cooperate together in order to stop the Soviet advance. They gain points by eliminating the attacking forces or by assisting other commanders. The game ends after 8 rounds, and then the person with the most points is the winner.

The game contains lots of cards, which feature historical persons, troops and equipment.

name: Ant Attack
description:
After the Great nuclear war... People are gone, Ants are Smart and the Backyard is at war!

Ant Attack is an exciting new 2 player card game of strategy requiring the correct amount of boldness, cunning and deception.  As overall commander, you deploy your units and leaders onto the battlefield into well-tuned squads in attempt to destroy your enemy.  Deploy snipers at the correct moment to wreak havoc on the less defended support units.  Send your scouts out to discover the enemy’s true makeup.  Know when to rally the troops and when to call for a truce.

Each game comes complete with 2 identical decks to begin your 6-legged struggle for control of the back yard.

name: Epic Resort
description:
Players compete to build the best resort for attracting fantasy heroes and tourists looking for fun and relaxation. The more you attract, the more likely monsters will attack!

				
				
					Overview

Hire and train your workers, build and upgrade your attractions, and convince your battle weary heroes to fight just one more time so without letting too many tourists get eaten! Gain Victory points by upgrading attractions and giving Heroes the rest they need. The highest scoring player when all monsters are defeated is the winner.

				
				
					Setup

Each player begins with a humble resort consisting of a Beach, a Tiki Hut and a small number of Tourists, placed at each attraction. Each player starts with their own worker Deck consisting of 7 Apprentices, 3 Street Performers, and 3 Lazy Peons.

				
				
					Gameplay

Each round consists of 4 phases:

				
				
					Phase I - Get to Work


     Each Player draws a hand of 5 Workers from their Worker Deck.
     Players simultaneously send worker cards from their hand to do work at each of their Attractions. Any missing units of work (are required by the Attraction) cause Tourists to leave before gathering resources.
     Players gain the primary resource of Gold by having more tourists at each attraction, and Flair by having less tourists. 


				
				
					Phase II - Action: Attract, Hire & Upgrade

In order, players take one action per turn or pass. Players will be interacting with common draft areas, as well as using abilities from their own workers and attractions. Possible actions include:

     Attract Tourists from the Dock (Spending Flair) - Tourists are placed at attractions, potentially increasing the Gold gained on the subsequent turn.
     Attract a Hero from the Dock (Spending Flair) - Heroes start with low health, which is gained at the end of each round. Fully Rested Heroes are scored for Victory Points.
     Upgrade an Attraction (Spending Gold) - Providing higher tourist capacity, better Gold payout, better abilities and more Victory Points. Upgraded attractions typically require more workers to keep them fully staffed.
     Train or Hire new Workers (Spending Gold) - Upgrade your workers to provide more work, or better abilities. Training locks a worker draft pile, preventing other players from upgrading to that particular worker during the round. Training workers is a 1-for-1 exchange, keeping players' Worker Deck lean by design. 
     Pass - The first Player to Pass becomes the Start Player for the next round


Any time during a player's turn, he may use abilities from fully-staffed attractions, or discard worker cards to use their unique abilities.

				
				
					Phase III - A Ship Arrives

The dock is refilled with new Heroes and Tourists from a center pile. While refilling, it's possible to trigger a Monster Attack!

     If an Attack! card is revealed, the top Monster from the Monster Pile will choose which player it's attacking; typically by Most Tourists or Most Heroes at their resort, ties broken clockwise from the start player.
     If a Hero defends against a Monster Attack, he loses 1 health. Any undefended damage causes tourists to be eaten by the Monster.
     Heroes may dodge into, or out of, a Monster Attack up to one time per round.
     If an attraction has no Hero or Tourists, a Monster will Damage it, potentially destroying the attraction.
     A player may chose (if they have one) to throw a Lazy Peon at the monster, ending the attack and permenantly removing the Worker Card from the game.
     The Dock Continues to refill, potentially triggering more Monster Attacks, until it is full.


				
				
					Phase IV - Clean Up


     Used and unused Workers are placed in players' discard piles.
     Any fully-rested Heroes are scored - Placed to the side, each worth Victory Points at the end of the game. This Hero also removes the top Monster from the remaining Monster Deck.
     Remaining Heroes gain 1 Health each.
     Any Locked Worker Draft Piles and Attraction Abilities are made available for the next round.
     Any unused Flair is sent back to the supply. Gold carries over to the next round.


Gameplay continues with Phase I

				
				
					Game End

If at the end of the round  there are no Monsters remaining, the game is over and players total Victory Points from Attractions, Scored Heroes, and 1 point for each remaining Hero at their resort. The player with the highest Victory Point total has built the most Epic Resort and is victorious!

name: It's a Dice Game, After All!
description:
It's a Dice Game, After All! is a free (not for profit) print-and-play game inspired by the Days of Wonder game Small World. In this game, you play as one of twelve fantasy-themed tribes attempting to colonize the world by any means necessary.

The object of the game is to be the player with the most victory points after 10 turns. Points are earned by maintaining the size of your tribe, and by rolling dice to extend your civilization into new regions. Special powers and abilities may also offer the potential for bonus points.

This game has no official association with Small World, its publisher Days of Wonder, its designer Philippe Keyaerts, or its artist Miguel Coimbra. This is strictly a product of fandom for the wonderful game that these people have produced.

name: Digimon Fusion
description:
Digimon Fusion is a CCG based on the newest Digimon animated series, which launched on Nickelodeon in September, 2013.

The Digimon Fusion CCG will be available in two SKUs: Theme Decks (Red and Blue), and Booster Packs. The Theme Decks contain 40 cards (a 30 card deck and 10 card booster), and are packaged eight to a display. The Boosters contain 10 cards (of a 60 card set), and are packaged 15 to a display.

The cards follow a similar rarity system as the Power Rangers Action Card Game: C (Common), R (Rare), SR (Super Rare), and U (Ultra Rare). Each Booster Pack comes with 10 cards: 6 Commons, 3 Rares, and 1 Super/Ultra Rare.

name: Dungeon Doors
description:
Be The Dungeon Hero or The Dungeon Boss! Devious Deceptions Galore!

THE DUNGEON HERO


     You're a dangerous fool armed with a random Deathball!
     Bash down doors with hate!
     Imbibe mysterious potions!
     Sleep in an inn--FTW!
     Control giant Green Slimes with fire!
     Destroy three Beholders and win the game!


THE DUNGEON BOSS

     Deploy your minions behind Red Doors of Doom!
     Throw the Dungeon Zero's fireballs back at him!
     Mentally push around your enemy through Secret Doors of your choice!
     Your enemy only has 5HP? ...Cake!


Contents:

2 - Rules cards
1 - Cuttable card of three 'Fireballs', two 'Lovely Fireballs', and one 'Deathball
3 - Secret Door cards
1 - Monster Manual card
10 - Red Door cards

    5 - Pink Life crystals



    Now included at no additional cost! Track your Dungeon Hero's life with 1HP tokens or easy to pick up Pink Life crystals!

name: Popcorn
description:
A dexterity game in which a domed center containing 4 colors of marbles is then automated with 2 D cell batteries to begin to "pop" and move. On each of 4 sides of the dome is a row of slots for each player and colored to match each of the balls or popcorn; blue, green, white and red. In front of each slot is a button and if pressed will push out the popcorn that falls into the slot if it is not a matching color. Each slot can hold up to two balls and the goal is to get as many of your matching color as possible.

2 "D" cell batteries are required for popcorn effect to work.

name: Fenrir
description:
2 to 4 players

36 Fetter cards in 3 suits

1 Pawn

1 Movement track

Objective

Players are Norse gods trying to stop Fenrir from reaching and devouring Odin.

Setup

Place the pawn on the first wolf spot of the track board.

3 or 4 player game

The Deal

The dealer thoroughly shuffles the deck and deals out all 36 cards one at a time to each player.

The player to the left of the dealer goes first by asking one of the other players for a card by rank and suit. The player asking for a card must already hold at least one card of the same suit.

If the player that was asked has the requested card he plays the card to the table face up starting a discard pile (the cards should be fanned so that the rank and suit are showing). Then move the pawn along the track backwards the number of spaces indicated on that discarded card. Now the asking player continues his turn and may ask the same player or another player for a card.

If the player that was asked does not have the requested card then the asking player must discard face up onto the discard pile a card of the same suit asked and moves the pawn along the track forwards the number of spaces indicated on that discarded card and now the turn to ask passes to the next player to the left.

The gods win if they discard all their fetter cards before Fenrir reaches Odin, otherwise they lose.

A 2 player game

Each player is dealt a hand of 10 cards and the remaining 16 cards are stacked face down on the table. A player who does not have the requested card draws one card from the stock before asking the opponent for another card. The remaining rules are the same as in a 3 or 4 player game.

name: Pathfinder Dice Arena
description:
Pathfinder Dice Arena allows players to battle as their favorite Pathfinder heroes in tournaments for gold and glory. Players build up moves to create high scoring combos while using counter moves to interfere with their opponents’ actions.

Points are scored based on patterns of icons and colors formed within their grid. Players can also trigger more abilities from their character sheets and talent cards or by purchasing gear and Fate cards with gold. At the end of two rounds, the player with the most points wins the tournament.

name: Sakura
description:
Sakura is a 2-4 player game taking place during the Feudal Japan Era. Sakura is a strategy and a resource collection game.

The game begins by players assembling the game map with individual map tiles. Players then build a city and rice paddies, and collect resources to build an army.

Special Cards can be used to bolster your attack or weaken your enemy.

The game is over when any one player has conquered an enemy city.

name: Fin Finaud dans la cuisine
description:
Discover a new way to play a trivia game!

You don't need to have great knowledge to score points; just be smart.
Each player has question cards in his hand.

Your turn:
- Choose one of your questions.
- Choose who will respond and how you ask your question.
- Predict what the result will be (success or failure, for example).

If the chosen players or respond as you expected: you earn points.

400 questions, 6 ways to score points: no need to be a sage to win!

In this first chapter, Fin Finaud takes you to the world of cooking and food in Quebec and elsewhere.

name: Pan  T'es Mort
description:
The last shall be first...
Make sure to be the last!!!

The game is separated into two phases.

Phase one is a trick-taking game with simultaneous card selection. First we check for ties. The tie numbers are gone and then the highest card wins. Cards are 1 to 6. Four times per card.

If after the first check we have a 1 card and a 6, then the 1 card wins the trick.

So now all keep the winning trick cards and we are ready for phase 2.

Phase 2 is Russian roulette, a game of chance. We have 6 cards (bullet cards) in the middle of the table, as a revolver. 5 empty chambers and one with a bullet.

On your turn (beginning with the player with the most cards from phase one): 
You can draw a card (pull the trigger) or you can discard one card from that you collect before, to shuffle all open bullet cards back together and then draw one, you just spin the cylinder of the revolver, (no point to do it if you have to draw the first bullet)
or you can discard as many cards as alive players in the game to pass your turn to the next player.

When you draw we check if you die or live from the bullet card.
If you stay alive the game continues to the next player. If you die we shuffle the bullet cards and continue with the player with most cards.

Last man standing is the winner.

name: Middle East '48

Middle East '48 (originally known by Sinai '48) is a brigade level simulation of the Israeli War of Independence in May through June of 1948.

Map is 11x17 glossy paper of the Sinai through Lebanon, 64 uncut, one-sided counters on card stock.

One player commands the Jewish (Israeli) forces, while the other commands the various Arab forces. Game play is I-go, You-go with 15 game turns.

Victory is based on the number of major cities held by the Arabs at the end of the game.

Published in Wargaming: The Magazine of Fantasy & Historical Simulation, Issue 04.

name: Cat & Chocolate: Business Is Business
description:
Cat & Chocolate: Business Is Business can be played as a standalone game or combined with Cat & Chocolate. Instead of the original game's haunted mansion theme, Business Is Business revolves around wacky situations that arise from a life in the corporate world.

Each turn, the player draws an event and tells the story of how she would avoid disaster with up to 1-3 item cards in her hand. Whether it's "stomachache in the middle of a presentation" or "your boss's wig is off-center", what will you do when you have only sushi or a self-enrichment book? It's a test of the player's imagination and life experience!

Should your story be accepted by at least half of the other players, you get to keep the event card and play continues until a special event card called "End!" is revealed. Whoever has scored the most event cards wins.

name: Unsun karuta
description:
A traditional Japanese trick-taking card game based on the European game Ombre (originally "l'Hombre"), played with a special 75-card five-suited deck. This deck developed from TenshÅ karuta, itself a close copy of the 48-card traditional Portuguese cards called "dragon cards" due to the dragons holding the suit symbols in the aces. Its creation was prompted by a ban on the older form of playing cards after Japan closed off the contact with the Western world in 1633, and became critical towards everything of European origin. Sunkun karuta took this game one step further.

The deck contains all 48 cards from TenshÅ karuta; these are supplemented by introducing a fifth suit and increasing the number of cards in each suit from twelve to fifteen. Most additions refer to Japanese and Chinese culture, presumably a conscious choice intended to downplay the European origins of the game.

The suits are ã¯ã† (hau), "flower" based on Portuguese 'paus' meaning "clubs", ã„ã™ (isu) a shortened form of 'espadas' or "swords", ã“ã£ã· (koppu) from 'copas' or  "cups", ãŠã†ã‚‹ (Åru) from 'ouros' or "coins" (literally "golds") and finally the added ãã‚‹ (guru) with the traditional Japanese ä¸‰ã¤å·´ (mitsudomoe) sign as suit symbol. As in the European predecessor games, higher-numbered pip cards beat lower ones only in the former two suits, while the latter ones are "reversed".

The "dragon aces" are split into two distinct ranks by reintroducing a normal "one" in each suit and separate from the ã‚ã°ã„ (robai) or "dragon" which normally ranks right above the ones. Above the number cards (1–9 plus robai) there are five court cards. From low to high, these are: ãã†ãŸ (sÅta) "queen", ã†ã¾ (uma) "horse", ãã‚Š (kiri) "soldier" (originally a king), ã†ã‚“ (un) various Japanese mythological figures and ã™ã‚“ (sun) various Chinese officials. The latter two ranks give the game its name. In the trump suit, the robai is promoted to above the kiri and the sÅta above this again, except that the robai of hau is a permanent trump which is the fourth highest regardless of which suit is trump.

name: Monopolino
description:
Object of the game: be the richest player when the game ends. The game ends when a player runs out of money.

How to play: every player take 10 houses (14 for 2 players). Every player takes 5x1000, 4x2000, 3x3000, 1x4000 1x5000. Players roll the dice to move.

If movement ends on a space without house: the player pays the bank the sum written on the space and becomes the owner. Players that end their turn on this space pay the owner the same sum. If the owner owns all houses on spaces of the same color the sum will be double.

If movement ends on the GO space: the player takes 2000 from bank.

If the movement ends on STATION space: reroll the dice and move again.

If the movement ends on RISK space: draw a card from the deck and follow the instructions.

If the movement ends on CAKE and BALLOON space: the player puts 2000 on LOTTERY space.

If the movement ends on LOTTERY space: the player takes all money on the space.

If the movement ends on GO TO SHOOTING GALLERY space: the player puts 3000 on LOTTERY space and goes on SHOOTING GALLERY space without passing the GO space.

RISK cards with HOUSE written: the player puts his house on a same color space written on card. If all of the same colour boxes are occupied by one player, the player has to draw another card. If the boxes are occupied by different players, the player replaces the home with their own.

name: Veletas
description:
Introduction

Veletas is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of a 10x10 checkered square board, which is initially empty. Apart from the board, the necessary material comprises seven shooters and a sufficient number of black and white stones.

Both players control a number of neutral red pieces and shoot stones of their own colour from them. In order to win, a player must claim a majority of neutral pieces by having them surrounded by larger groups of their own pieces than their opponent's.

This game won (along with Four) the BoardGameGeek Best Combinatorial 2-Player Game of 2013 Award.

				
				
					Definitions

A piece is a shooter, a black stone or a white stone.

A group is a set of one or more like-colored, orthogonally adjacent stones. The size of a group is the number of stones in it. Stones on top of shooters are not part of any groups.

A trapped shooter is a shooter that cannot make any legal move in the current position.

				
				
					Play

The first player begins by placing three shooters and one black stone on empty squares of the board. The second player then chooses which player will be Black and which will be White. Next, White places the remaining four shooters and one white stone on empty squares of the board. In both cases, no shooters can be placed orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to any other shooters. This restriction does not apply to the rest of the game.

From then on, the players take turns, starting with Black. On your turn, you may (but are not obliged to) move a shooter to an empty square in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line, without jumping over any other pieces. Then, you must place a stone of your color on an empty square that is a straight orthogonal or diagonal line away from the square onto which the shooter was moved (or from any shooter, if none was moved), with no other pieces in between along that line. This is called shooting. Claimed shooters (see below) cannot move or shoot.

At this moment, if there are any trapped shooters on the board that have not been claimed before, each one of them is claimed by the player who owns the biggest group orthogonally adjacent to it. If there is no such group or the biggest such groups of each color are the same size, the shooter is claimed by the opponent. Claiming a shooter is indicated by placing a stone of the corresponding color on top of it. Claimed shooters remain unchanged for the rest of the game.

The game ends when a player has claimed the majority of shooters, i.e. at least four of them. That player wins. Draws are not possible.

				
				
					Smaller versions

For shorter but still reasonable games, the following variants are suggested:


     7x7 board with three shooters. The first player places one shooter, and White places the other two. Whoever claims two shooters wins.



     9x9 board with five shooters. The first player places two shooters, and White places the other three. Whoever claims three shooters wins.


Online Play


     Board Game Arena (real-time, turn-based)
     Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)


Mobile Apps

     Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, IOS
     Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, Android

name: Eiertanz, Das Kartenspiel
description:
From the publisher's website:

Alarm in the hen house! Everybody tries to snatch the most egg cards and not let them drop. That is not so easy: whoever receives an egg card has to clasp it under his chin, between his knees or in other very unlikely positions. When it comes to the big egg dance, everybody has to run up to the matching hen ? but keep in mind that scoring is done as soon as one player loses one of his egg cards.

name: Verhexte Fabelwesen
description: The Sorcerer's Apprentices want to go to the castle of the famous wizard, but no one knows the way through the sinister magic forest. That's why they need to find the enchanted mythical creatures that live hidden in the woods. Only they can help the sorcerer's apprentices to reach to the wizard. The aim of the game is to assemble mythical creatures from two cards and to get to the castle of the magician first.

name: Greed
description:
In the card game Greed, crime lords (the players) try to earn more money than anyone else through clever use of their cards.

At the start of the game, each player receives a random hand of twelve cards from a deck of 80. Players draft one card, pass the remaining cards left, draft a second card, pass again, draft a third card, pass again, then the game changes; players simultaneously choose and reveal a card, carrying out its effects, then they draft another card, pass the remaining cards, play again, and so on until ten "playing" rounds have passed, at which point the game ends and players tally their holdings.

The card types are thugs, holdings and actions. Thugs and holdings might have a cost to be played (perhaps cash paid to the bank or the discarding of a holding) or a condition that you must meet (having two thugs, for example, or a collection of symbols on cards in your possession) in addition to an effect, which is unique to each card. (Each action has a unique effect as well.) When you play a holding with one or more symbols, you place a token on that card for each symbol on it and an additional token for each symbol of that type already in your possession. These tokens are worth $10k each at the end of the game, and you add this value to whatever cash you've collected through your card plays.

name: With Ketchup
description:
Dragons like Knights, and Knights like Dragons... With ketchup!

2 players face off, one as the Dragon, and one as the Knight.
Winner of 2 out of 3 battles between 3 (or 4) unique match-ups of a Dragon and a Knight.  Is it the Plate armored Knight vs the Hatchling Dragon, or the peasant wearing Quilted armor vs the Ancient Dragon?  You won't know until you flip your Armor Cards!

Each player has 4 levels of protection (Armor) as well as Effort cards and Weapon Cards.  
The Knight can attack with a [Mighty] and [Good] Effort with his [Razor Sharp] [Halberd] for 11 points, or if his hand is full of weak cards, he'll be forced to make a [Pitiful] Effort to attack with his [Crossbow] for 2 points.
What to play, what to hang on to?  Deceptively simple, with a deeper strategy.

Whoever defeats their opponent by reducing their Health to zero in combat will have dinner when they're done.

name: Snow Ball Fight!!
description:
Snow Ball Fight!! pits 2 teams of kids (5 kids per team) in a snowball fight to the last man standing!  Each team member has a number, and a color, so your little one can practice matching and identifying their colors and numbers.

Draw cards from the draw pile and see if you hit someone, miss, or miss by elimination (each kid can only be hit once), and be the first to decimate your opponent!

name: TP'd
description:
You and your friends have sneaked onto the Johnson's property, and now it's time to TP their trees!

Each player has a picture mat with a Tree on it, and a complete deck of TP/Hazard cards.  Your goal is to TP as much of the tree as possible before the cops show up, while dealing with Hazards which will remove your TP.

A Deck contains 2 complete games; 2 Play mats and 2 complete decks of cards with different colored backs to help identify which deck they belong to.

The game can be played solitaire (using 1 deck and 1 Mat), or versus; each player using a mat, combining the decks into 1 big deck, and playing the Hazards on each other!

Three different color sets are available, allowing up to 6 miscreants to be TP'ing the Johnson's trees at once!

name: Castle Crush!

Players not only need to know how to attack effectively, but also must create a strong castle in order to defend against different types of attacks. Whoever collects the most points wins!

description:

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

name: Verrückt
description:
Verrück doch mal
German text on backside of the box: In diesem spannenden Spiel wird versucht, durch Bildung möglichst vieler und langer Wörter die meisten Punkte zu erzielen. Durch das Verrücken von Buchstabenchips muss ein Wort gebildet werden, wobei jeder verwendete Buchstabenchip Punkte bringt. Auch Sonderpunkte sind möglich. Die Spieler sind abwechselnd an der Reihe, wodurch sich immer wieder neue Möglichkeiten ergeben. Optimales Wort gefunden? Oder sind etwa noch mehr Punkte möglich? Flexibles Denken ist hierbei gefragt. Doch Eile ist geboten, denn die Zeit läuft ab.

English: Try to get the most points by creating the most and the longest words. Build it by shifting letter chips, every chip counts. Players alternate, so every time new chances occur. Found the optimal word? Or are more points possible? But do not dawdle, time runs short.

name: A Wolf in Sheep's Clothing
description:
Two players are prospective sheep farmers aiming to herd the most Sheep from a Flock.

Every turn, players will choose one card from their hand and play it face-down in a Flock, while saying "bah" for each Sheep on the card. Players can choose to tell the truth or lie about how many Sheep there actually are. Once there are seven or more "bah"s said between all players, a player can summon the Dog and say "bark, bark, bark!" If there's no Wolf, the player can pick up the Flock and check for the Wolf. If there's no Wolf, the player can harvest some Sheep, getting them closer to victory, or if there's a Wolf, it has eaten some Sheep! Players can also accuse one another for playing the Wolf, with game-altering consequences. Accumulate 9 sheep during the game and you win!

name: Divvy: The Pirate Loot Game
description:
Being a pirate is dangerous, filled with adventure and wonders to be seen. However all of that is not why we do what we do. We do it for the loot, the gold gems that sparkle and drive us insane. All the bloodthirsty pillaging, all the cannon fire, it's all to get the loot. Once the voyage is over, it's what we wait for, the Divvying of the loot!

In Divvy, you take the role of pirates on a voyage. Each round is a voyage to obtain loot for the crew. On your turn, you pick a mission for the crew to go on, and attempt to complete the mission. Completed missions give you infamy among the crew and places money through the hold of the ship. At the end of the voyage pirates take their share of the loot, and voyage once more.

The first pirate to have enough gold to retire from the violent lifestyle wins!

name: KickShot Soccer Strategy Board Game
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

There are One Bra-zillion™ ways to score with KickShot and Rio-lize™ your soccer goals. KickShot® is a board game for 5 year old kids through adults that closely mimics an actual soccer game. Play KickShot with dice, action and referee cards to strategically move the ball across a board, intercept, and score goals. The game supports three levels of play depending on age and desired challenge.

Learn proper ways to execute soccer action with endearing characters
- Move the ball down the pitch with action cards
- Earn referee cards for penalty, corner kicks, offside and direct free kicks
- Advance through three levels of play: kids "grow" from Junior, Warm Up and League Games

KickShot Board Game and all the associated products make ideal birthday and holiday gifts, and fundraisers for soccer clubs and non-profits. The products will surely get the entire family into the spirit of World Cup 2014.

name: Abenteuer in Mexiko
description:
The players are miners, whose objective is to transport bags of silver from their mine to the harbor of Vera Cruz (end space).

It's a simple roll and move game. When the meeples land on a marked space, the players have to follow the instructions in the rules. While passing through the "Indian Gorge" the meeples are in danger from an Indian, who is moved, whenever an odd number is rolled. The player who is the first to reach the end space is the winner of the game.

name: Ophir
description:
Ophir is a pick up and deliver, set collection game set in an ancient, prosperous world for 2-4 players. In Ophir, you're an influential person of government, trade, or religion with a singular focus - the construction of the Temple.

The Temple is built layer by layer through collective contributions of Silver and Gold. These precious metals are delivered by your merchant ship for Victory Points at the Temple, one of the seven locations you'll be visiting in Ophir.

To afford these precious building materials, you must navigate the region's seas against your rivals to collect goods to fulfill the demand at the Market for Coins, or exchange them for Favor at the Temple.

Well-timed trades, efficient cargo storage, and tactical transportation will be the keys to your success. But you must be swift in your travels, because the game ends immediately once the construction of the Temple is complete. Will it be you whose name is spoken alongside the stories of Ophir's wonder?

With its approachable map and exclusion of direct conflict, Ophir has a familiar and accessible atmosphere that families will enjoy. But with its modular setup, exclusive player roles, and mercurial market, Ophir has tactics, replayability, and tension for experienced gamers to savor!

name: Chikken
description:
Chikken is a game of dice, risk, strategy, and luck.  It's designed for two to six players of any age, as long as they can understand how to make matches with dice.

The goal is to get as high a score as possible without losing your turn. To do this, you roll five special dice (four white, one red), each with one side blank. The red die is called the "Danger Die."  If at any time you roll all white blanks, or you roll a red blank, your turn ends without scoring.

You score points by making three/four/five-of-a-kind matches or a straight (1-2-3-4-5). After each roll, you can stop and bank your points (gaining bonus points for matches, plus the total of all spots on the dice), or you can set aside dice of your choice and reroll what's left. However, you MUST set aside any blank white dice after each roll.

An added element of risk management comes when you have a bonus score available, such as from four-of-a-kind. When you do, you have the extra choice of hanging onto those bonus points and rerolling all five dice, with the bonus score still in jeopardy if you should roll blanks and lose your turn. This lets you "start over" with a higher starting value, but all the same risks of losing your turn.

Educational Value

Chikken teaches kids to understand and analyze risks. For younger kids, it's a matching game, and for slightly older ones, they can count up spots, or add up the numbers as they go. And it's still fun for everyone!

name: Onmitsu
description:
Onmitsu is a Print-and-Play "small card" game. Besides the rules, the whole game is contained in one 54-card deck of cards.

In Onmitsu, you are a spy – an Onmitsu – a sort of spy slash messenger slash ninja slash espionage secret kind of sneak. Your job is to deliver a scroll with a message to your Lord’s boss, the Daimyo. You have a sealed scroll – but so does everyone else. Nobody knows how has which one, either.

Only one message is the “real” message. Others are decoys (which need to be delivered, but aren’t worth as much) and at least “Poison” scroll – a scroll with a hidden message to kill the bearer. Someone doesn’t trust you very much…

Your job is to not only deliver the scroll, but figure out which one you and the other players have. You can always crack yours open to find out, but if the Daimyo shows up before you repair it (or pass it off on some other spy) you are in trouble.

Game play is simple – you draw and discard to form a hand of cards, each of which can be Locations or People. All of them give you the ability to perform actions like steal cards, repair broken scrolls, gain intelligence, or other forms of intrigue.

You win by having the most points, earned by delivering the most important scroll, accumulating cards, and not being the messenger who gets killed.

name: Kingdom Land
description:
The King of Kingdom Land has perished and left his subjects with no heir to rule their fair land. Enter the Barons who all vie for the crown despite their colorful quirks. Using their followers and keen sense of tactics, players will use their baron to jockey for position and finally take rule of the land.

In Kingdom Land players will take on the role of Baron's vying for the vacant throne. Players will roll custom dice in an effort to build up specific types of followers all while trying to gain majority over the regions that make up Kingdom Land. Players will also have the opportunity to learn specific tactics and build monuments which with further increase their chance of dominance. After six rounds Kingdom Land will be evaluated and the Baron with the most points will fill the empty throne of Kingdom Land and rule forever!

name: Rugrats Water Fun Park Adventure Game
description:
Race your favorite Rugrats character along the colored path and up the Super Slide steps.  The first character to reach the top and slide down into the middle space is the winner!

On your turn, spin the color wheel and move your character forward to the first space that matches the color on the spinner.  If you land on a ticket space, spin the wheel again except this time you will move along the path that matches the symbol that the wheel stops on.  Once you reach the Super Slide and spin the red or blue color, drop your character down the chute.  If you land in the middle window, you are the winner!

name: Feudalizm
description:
Feudalizm is a strategy game set in a medieval atmosphere. The player takes on the role of a local prince and expanding the power of subordinate lands. The game offers a wide range of possible actions: construction of castles, towns, cities and rural location, construction of business facilities, trade, sieges and assaults of castles or towns. The action is varied random events in the form of cards. The modular system allows the board to change its appearance at each game.

Each player starts the game with the disposal of city, a sum of money, a certain amount of raw materials and the deployment of troops and several farm buildings. The player's task is to manage the development of his principality by building new business facilities, colonize new areas, increasing the strength of the army, the establishment of villages and towns, castles extension locks. The main objective pursued by each of the players is dominance over its rivals, which can be obtained on how the economic or military conquering lands belonging to the opponents.

The game is divided into rounds, each round corresponds to one seasonal: spring, summer, autumn, winter. During each turn a player can perform up to four specific actions. The game ends when one player has to fulfill the conditions of economic or military dominance over their opponents.

The basic raw materials present in the game are : wood , stone , ore, iron , food , horses, consumer goods , and weapons and armor .

The game includes a deck of 30 cards random discovered alternately by the players. There are also so-called card . advisors drawn or selected before the start of the game . Features counselors have a significant impact on the course of the game.

The currency of the game are known. kordyty denominations of 1 , 2, 5 and 10 Outbuildings, workers, settlers , towns and villages are in the form of cardboard chips. Castles in the discretion of the buyer may be in the form of chips or resin models.

In choosing the path of military conquest available to the player are various units : light and heavy cavalry , infantry peasant, municipal police, swordsmen, axemen, halberdiers, archers, crossbow and machine battle . Battles can be resolved in a very fast manner (for the impatient players) , or on the board battle (for players with a strategic verve ).

name: Kingdoms CG
description:
Simple card game for 2-4 people.

Players are trying to form their own province in a kingdom using 5 different characters.

Players must always look after single provinces to make sure that each of them makes the maximum income to the royal treasury. Once shall you overlook any bad thing about any province and it will pull your growing kingdom back. And also neighbors will never leave you in peace trying to advance their kingdoms and take a piece of other lands.

name: Wunderteam
description:
Two or four player soccer game using metal miniatures; players each have 1 field player and 1 goalie, using a ball that position determines the possession/active player. On a board with checkerboard patterns different areas (dark & light) determine who's next to kick (dark or light team).

The player puts the field kicker next to the ball and releases its leg to kick the ball. The other player should try to block the kick with his/her goal keeper. After the kick the possession is once more decided and the same procedure starts all over again.

Goalies can be managed by two other players, game lasts 2 x 10 minutes.

Remarks: Game was produced during 1930's; 'Wunderteam' was a specific name for the Austrian national soccer team during the years 1931 up to 1933.

name: Flipp und Flapp
description:
Objective: get familiar with additon/subtraction of small numbers
 - collection of a few different math games for preschoolers -

1. Be the first to reach 10 exactly: put on appropriate math sheet, turn the spinner and add or subtract shown number.

2. Be the first to get rid of your 11 wooden slides with different numbers: put on appropriate math sheet, turn the spinner and solve the math formula by filling in the correct slide.

name: Collision
description:
Collision is a super-hero deck building game, created by Magenic Technologies. In Collision, players play as software superheroes (The Automator, The Architect, The Oracle, Big Data, and The Mechanic) to build a deck utilizing additional heroes, super-powers, gear, and additional equipment to fight villains big and small, from small bugs all the way up to the evil Retrograde and Rain Cloud.

On each turn, the active player plays cards from their hands. Most cards in the game yield from 1 to 5 power, which is the main currency of the game. Other cards allow manipulation of the player's discard pile, drawing additional cards, ridding the deck of unwanted cards or additional bonuses. Having accumulated power during their turn, players finally use their power to purchase additional cards to increase their deck's strength. Each card purchased is worth victory points, and the person who has the most victory points at the end of the game is the winner!

name: Robin Hood 2888
description:
Robin Hood and his gifted team of young vigilantes must help the downtrodden people of their land and deal with evil plots of the Sheriff – before finally meeting up with the villain himself in a final showdown to decide the fate of the Nottingham Sector.

This is a fully cooperative game which takes place over a series of rounds. Players must work together, pooling their time and resources, to contend with sinister plots affecting the Nottingham Sector.

By rolling specific types of dice (Combat, Stealth, or Diplomacy), players may choose how best to resolve the Plots. At the end of each round, the Threat Level may rise, making subsequent rounds much harder.

In the end, the players will have to push forward through the Sheriff's fortress-like Factory to confront the villain himself!

Only through careful management of the dice, tactical decisions about how to resolve the Plots, and a little luck of the roll will Robin Hood and his heroic team win the day!

name: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
description:
The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug is an exciting game of adventure in which you join Bilbo Baggins™ and his 13 dwarven companions on their journey through the Mirkwood Forest and Laketown, to the goldfilled caverns of Lonely Mountain. Along the way The Company will encounter spiders, elves, orcs, and finally the dragon Smaug himself.

Traverse your way through two boards, each more difficult than the last, with the goal of coming out alive and prepared for the dangers that lie ahead. Your accumulated points at the end of the game will be your group’s mark for finding out how good of a team you really are!

New elements not found in the first game include “The Dragon’s Path” and the “Dwarven Barrel Escape.” Each adds new twists and tension to the game. Combine the two games for a wild ride and see how well your team can do!

This is a standalone game, but it’s also an expansion to The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey.

A trivia game about the popular TV series, Duck Dynasty.  Answer questions and complete famous quotes to see who knows this show better among your family or friends! Fool other players with your believable answers and spot the genuine quotes from among the decoys to score.

Players race to answer the most questions correctly for the first player/team that makes it once around the board wins!

1 Die
1 Game Board
4 Movers and 4 Mover Bases
130 Quote Cards
70 Trivia Cards
10 Rules Cards
Game Instructions

name: Armies of the Dead
description:
Each player starts with four dice of each of six types (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, and d20), and the first to lose all twenty-four dice loses the game.  Each battle is different according to the terrain dice thrown, which determine how many and which dice may battle, if any are modified/doubled, and how many actions each player may take per turn.  Each type of die has basic abilities (resurrection/banishment, mimicry, split attacks, join-forces, re-roll opponent die/dice, re-roll own die/dice), and all but the d4 have special abilities activated by rolling pairs (or more) of the same number.

The player with initiative (usually lower total roll) takes one, two, or three actions (based on the throw of the terrain dice) before the opponent has a chance to respond. Actions include one die attacking another or activating abilities, or activating abilities and then attacking an opponent's die (most common).

There is a balance between thinking through the possibilities and over-thinking what your opponent may do, particularly in the selection of which dice to roll at the beginning of each battle.  Each battle will consist of different combinations of dice, resulting in different abilities interacting, keeping the game fresh and interesting throughout.

name: Cabals: The Board Game
description:
The First World War is over and it is time to choose your side. Underground secret societies, or rather cabals, are battling for world domination. Containing spies, witches, faeries, magicians and other creatures from all over the world you must select your cabal wisely.

Cabals: The Board Game brings together key deck building mechanics with board control in a new battle that can either be won through board domination or conquering the opponents stronghold. Once the battleground has been constructed the luck of the draw and your deck building skills dictate what creatures you have at your disposal. Units battle one another backed up by spells and lead by a single hero for your deck from one of the four cabals.

The turn sequence comprises of gaining domination points, gaining resources, drawing cards, the main strategic phase (containing combat) and ending your turn. Resources dictate what cards you can use and this combined with loyalty points (depending on the cabals and their allegiances) the player has a deep, strategic game to conquer on many levels. The game is based on the digital Cabals: Magic & Battle Cards and these same key mechanics prevail but this version has more streamlined gameplay suitable to a tabletop game.

name: Battle of the Alamo
description: This is a game about the Alamo with a military theme. Designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, or 4 players ages 10 or older with different skill levels for each age group. One player represents the Alamo defenders. The other player or players represent the attacking Mexican army. The outer pathway is a square depicting the walls of the fort. The inner pathway is a circle depicting the interior of the fort. Players move along the outer pathway by throwing dice and drawing event cards. Once a breach has been created the action moves to the interior for a final showdown. Includes tournament rules for a five game series to create play balance for the beleaguered Texans.

name: Wintersport
description:
Objective: Be the first racing to position '100'

Typical 'Roll & Move' game from the 1910's in Germany. Roll the die by turns and step forward - until you end on a special field - follow instructions glued on lid inside.

Special rules: players are kicked out / must start again if touched or passed by others. Use 2 dice before passing space 84.

name: Alarm! U-Boot!
description:
What is it all about?

Two fleets fight against each other during the game. Their aim is to destroy the enemy’s Command Ship. However this is a hard challenge because the game offers several options to obstruct or threaten the enemy’s vessels. Planting sharp mines in the route of the ships is one of them, or you may choose to bluff and plant fake mines that look exactly like real ones...

How does it play?

- Every turn the active player rolls a die. The die shows how many actions you have to take in your round: 1, 2 or 3. 
 - After you roll, you can plant mines on empty fields if you want.
 - Now choose a ship and spend your actions. Turn, move or shoot. Every ship type has its unique weapons, and specific role in the battle.
 - The first player who hits their opponent's Command Ship is the winner.

What this game offers:

- short, simple, easy-to-understand rules,
- quick set up, no more than 5 minutes after the second game,
- relatively short rounds (30-45 minutes), no time to get bored.

name: Inertia
description:
Inertia is a game of unification in the sense of Claude Soucie's Lines of Action. The first player to unite all of his pieces on the board into a single group wins.

To start, white places one piece anywhere on the 8x8 square board. Players then alternate placing pieces on the board, with the first piece being adjacent to the opponent's most recently placed piece and the second piece being adjacent to no pieces, either orthogonally or diagonally.

Once a player can't place a second piece, the placement phase ends and the next player starts the movement phase. On a turn, a player moves one piece akin to a queen in chess, with movement ending after passing through any number of empty spaces or by landing on an opponent's piece and capturing it. If this move increases the total number of groups on the board — with a group being a single stone or a series of straight- or diagonally-connected like-colored stones — then the move is illegal. Gameplay continues until one player unites all of his pieces into a single group; if he simultaneously creates single groups for both players, then the game is a draw.

Instead of using a chess board, Inertia can be played on a hexhex board with pieces moving like hex rooks.

name: Overlords: The Card Game
description:
The evil empire is divided. Amidst the chaos, several overlords emerge to claim rule over all by raising great armies of hellish creatures. They all yearn for power but only one will emerge victorious.

Overlords is a set collection, card drafting game for 2-4 players. Each turn, players recruit one card from their hand and then pass the rest of their hand to the player on their left. Every time a card is recruited, it goes into that player’s army pile. Only the top card is visible in each player’s army at any given time. There are two types of cards available in the game—Monster cards and Hired Hand cards. Each Monster card has a unique scoring mechanism. Players must recruit them wisely in order to maximize the amount of points of their army. Hired hand cards are placed separate from an army and, when activated, have special abilities that affect the game. The player who raises the most powerful army, wins! .

Overlords easily plays under 20 minutes. The game is simple to teach, yet tough to master. There is even a 2 vs 2 option that allows for some interesting team play.
